page.title: 04ECOLOGY
page.content: Our school field has been divided into two parts:one part is a football pitch,the other is a conservation area.This area has been set aside as a habitat for wild flora and fauna. We regularly study this area as part of our school work.The conservation area was planted with sixty {native {British trees}.We have oak,sycamore, holly,ash,sweet chestnut,and birch. There are three trees which are over one hundred years old.The conservation area is 80 metres by 30 metres,and was saved from commercial development by the intervention of the vicar, churchwardens,and representatives of Thorverton Parish Council.It is also a habitat for the wild flowers which are dying out from their natural habitat.
